definitions.definition: a person whose job is repairing machines, especially the engines of vehicles
the science of movement and force

examples.text: the school’s car maintenance department where students learn basic mechanics

definitions.definition: the working parts of a machine

examples.text: He looks at the mechanics of a car before the bodywork.

definitions.definition: the way something works or is done

examples.text: The exact mechanics of how payment will be made will be decided later.

wordOrigin: late Middle English (as an adjective in the sense ‘relating to manual labour’): via Old French or Latin from Greek mēkhanikos, from mēkhanē, from mēkhos ‘contrivance’.
